name: Big Toe Pose
description: Padangusthasana (Big Toe Pose) is a beginner-level standing forward bend.  Grab big toes for a gentle hamstring stretch, improving balance and calming the mind.  Keep spine long, knees slightly bent if needed.

name: Gorilla Pose
description: Gorilla Pose (Padahastasana) is a beginner standing forward bend.  Benefits include hamstring stretch and calming the mind.  Keep your spine long, knees slightly bent if needed, and reach for your feet, focusing on lengthening your spine rather than touching your toes.

name: Bird of Paradise Pose
description: A challenging balancing pose (Svarga Dvijasana), Bird of Paradise builds strength, flexibility, and focus.  Maintain a straight spine, engage core, and lengthen through the extended leg for optimal alignment.

name: Revolved Bird of Paradise Pose
description: A challenging standing balance (Parivritta Svarga Dvijasana), Revolved Bird of Paradise Pose strengthens legs, improves balance, and opens hips.  Maintain a straight spine, engage core, and lengthen through the torso as you twist.

name: Upward Salute
description: Urdhva Hastasana (Upward Salute) is a beginner standing pose.  Lengthen your spine, arms overhead, and open your chest.  Benefits include improved posture, increased energy, and stress relief.  Keep shoulders relaxed away from ears.

name: Chair Pose
description: Utkatasana (Chair Pose) strengthens legs and core, improves balance.  Stand tall, engage thighs and core,  sit back as if into a chair, keeping spine straight and chest lifted.

name: High Lunge Pose
description: High Lunge (Ashta Chandrasana) strengthens legs and opens hips.  Maintain a long spine, front knee aligned with ankle, and gaze forward.  Builds balance and stamina.

name: Low Lunge Pose
description: Anjaneyasana (Low Lunge) strengthens legs and hips, opening chest and shoulders.  Keep front knee over ankle, tailbone lengthening, and torso upright for optimal alignment. Beginner-friendly standing balance.

name: Eagle Pose
description: Eagle Pose (Garudasana) is a balancing standing pose improving focus and ankle strength. Wrap legs around one another, stacking shoulders, and gaze steadily ahead for balance.  Benefits include improved concentration and body awareness.

name: Standing Foot Behind the Head Pose
description: Durvasasana (Standing Foot Behind Head) is an advanced standing balance.  Improves hip flexibility, core strength, and balance.  Maintain a straight spine, engage core, and keep hips square. Requires significant practice.

name: Standing Foot to Head Pose
description: A challenging standing balance (Trivikramasana A), requiring strength and flexibility.  Builds leg strength, improves balance, and stretches hamstrings.  Maintain a straight spine and engage core for stability.

name: Standing Foot Behind the Head Forward Bend Pose
description: Richikasana (Standing Foot Behind Head Forward Bend) is an advanced standing forward bend.  Improves hamstring flexibility and balance.  Maintain a straight spine and engage core to avoid strain.

name: Half Standing Forward Bend Pose
description: Ardha Uttanasana (Half Standing Forward Bend) gently stretches hamstrings and spine.  Maintain a flat back, engaging core, and lengthening spine. Beginner-friendly pose promoting relaxation and improved balance.

name: Standing Forward Bend Pose
description: Uttanasana (Standing Forward Bend) is a beginner standing forward bend.  Benefits include calming the mind and relieving stress.  Keep a flat back, lengthen the spine, and bend from the hips, not the waist.

name: Standing Half Bound Lotus Forward Bend Pose
description: Ardha Baddha Padmottanasana (Standing Half Bound Lotus Forward Bend) stretches hips, groin, and hamstrings.  Maintain a straight spine, lengthen through the torso, and avoid forcing the bind. Intermediate level.

name: Goddess Pose
description: Goddess Pose (Utkata Konasana) is a beginner-friendly standing pose strengthening thighs, hips, and core.  Keep knees over ankles, chest lifted, and spine long for optimal alignment.

name: Half Moon Pose
description: Ardha Chandrasana (Half Moon Pose) is a beginner standing balance.  Strengthens legs and core, improves balance and flexibility.  Keep hips square, lengthen spine, and gaze forward for stability.

name: Revolved Half Moon Pose
description: Revolved Half Moon (Parivritta Ardha Chandrasana) is a beginner standing balance.  It strengthens legs and core, improves balance, and opens hips.  Maintain a straight spine, lengthen through the torso, and ground firmly through your supporting foot.

name: Extended Standing Hand to Big Toe Pose
description: Utthita Hasta Padangushthasana B (Extended Hand-to-Big-Toe Pose) strengthens legs, improves balance, and stretches hamstrings.  Maintain a straight spine, lengthen the torso, and engage core for stability.

name: Revolved Standing Hand to Big Toe Pose
description: Revolved Standing Hand-to-Big-Toe Pose (Parivritta Hasta Padangushthasana) improves balance, stretches hips and spine, and strengthens legs.  Maintain a straight spine, engage core, and lengthen through the side body.

name: Standing Hand to Big Toe Pose
description: Utthita Hasta Padangushthasana A (Standing Hand to Big Toe Pose) improves balance and hip flexibility.  Keep your standing leg straight, core engaged, and gaze forward.  Avoid hyperextending your knee.

name: Mountain Pose
description: Tadasana (Mountain Pose) is a foundational standing pose.  Cultivate grounding and stability by engaging your core, lengthening your spine, and distributing weight evenly.  Benefits include improved posture and body awareness.

name: Pyramid Pose
description: Pyramid Pose (Parshvottanasana) is a beginner standing forward bend strengthening legs and opening hips.  Maintain a straight spine, lengthen your front leg, and square your hips to the front.

name: Extended Side Angle Pose
description: Extended Side Angle Pose (Utthita Parshvakonasana) stretches hips, groins, and spine.  Keep front knee aligned with ankle, torso long, and gaze forward or upward.  Beginner-friendly standing lateral bend.

name: Standing Splits Pose
description: Urdhva Prasarita Eka Padasana (Standing Splits) improves balance, hip flexibility, and leg strength.  Maintain a straight spine, engage core, and evenly distribute weight.  Gradually increase leg height.

name: Dancer  Pose
description: Dancer Pose (Dandayamana Dhanurasana) is a balancing standing pose.  Strengthen legs and core, improve balance and flexibility.  Maintain a straight spine, gaze forward, and engage your standing leg.

name: Tree Pose
description: Tree Pose (Vrikshasana) is a beginner standing balance.  Improves stability, focus, and leg strength.  Ground firmly through your standing foot, press the inner thigh of your raised leg against your inner thigh, and maintain a straight spine.

name: Triangle Pose
description: Triangle Pose (Utthita Trikonasana) is a beginner standing pose.  Lengthen your spine,  extend your arm towards your leg, keeping hips squared.  Benefits include improved balance, hip opening, and hamstring stretch.

name: Revolved Triangle Pose
description: Revolved Triangle Pose (Parivritta Trikonasana) is a beginner-level standing twist.  It improves balance, stretches hips and spine, and stimulates digestion.  Maintain a long spine, engage core, and avoid collapsing into the twist.

name: Warrior I Pose
description: Warrior I (Virabhadrasana I) is a beginner standing pose strengthening legs and core.  Ground through feet, lengthen spine, and extend arms overhead, keeping hips square.  Builds strength and stamina.

name: Warrior II Pose
description: Warrior II (Virabhadrasana II) strengthens legs and opens hips.  Stand with feet wide, front knee bent, torso long, and gaze over front hand.  Maintain hip alignment and engaged core.

name: Warrior III Pose
description: Warrior III (Virabhadrasana III) builds strength and balance.  Stand on one leg, extending the other back, torso parallel to the ground.  Keep hips square and gaze forward for stability.

name: Wide Legged Forward Bend I Pose
description: Wide-legged forward bend (Prasarita Padottanasana A) gently stretches hamstrings, hips, and calves.  Keep legs straight, spine long, and head relaxed.  Beginner-friendly, focus on lengthening your spine before folding forward.

name: Wide Legged Forward Bend II Pose
description: Prasarita Padottanasana B (Wide-Legged Forward Bend II):  A beginner standing forward bend stretching hamstrings, groins, and calves.  Keep legs straight, hips squared, and lengthen spine before folding.

name: Wide Legged Forward Bend III Pose
description: Prasarita Padottanasana C (Wide-Legged Forward Bend III) gently stretches hamstrings, hips, and calves.  Maintain straight legs and a flat back, lengthening the spine as you fold.  Beginner-friendly.

name: Wide Legged Forward Bend IV Pose
description: Prasarita Padottanasana D (Wide-Legged Forward Bend IV): A beginner standing forward bend.  Lengthens hamstrings and calves, improves balance.  Keep legs straight, spine long, and chest towards thighs.

name: Revolved Wide Legged Forward Bend
description: Deepen your forward bend in Parivritta Prasarita Padottanasana.  This intermediate pose gently twists the spine, relieving back tension and improving hip flexibility.  Maintain a straight spine and lengthen through the crown of your head.

name: Side Wide Legged Forward Bend
description: A standing forward bend stretching hamstrings, groins, and calves.  Wide legs create a deep side stretch.  Maintain a straight spine, engaging core to protect lower back.  Ground through feet evenly.

name: Archer's Pose
description: Archer Pose (Akarna Dhanurasana) is an intermediate seated twist that strengthens core and back muscles, improves spinal flexibility, and opens the hips.  Maintain a straight spine and lengthen through the crown of your head.

name: Boat Pose
description: Boat Pose (Navasana) strengthens core, back, and hip flexors.  Sit with knees bent, lifting torso and legs to form a "V."  Maintain a long spine and engage core to avoid rounding.  Beginner-friendly, gradually increase the leg extension.

name: Bound Angle Pose
description: Baddha Konasana (Bound Angle Pose): A beginner seated pose.  Opens hips and inner thighs, promoting relaxation.  Keep spine straight, knees dropping towards the floor, and gently press feet into groin.

name: Both Feet Behind the Head I Pose
description: A challenging seated advanced pose (Dvi Pada Shirshasana A), balancing both feet behind the head.  Strengthens core, shoulders, and back. Requires significant flexibility and spinal mobility. Maintain a straight spine and engage core to avoid neck strain.

name: Cow Face Pose
description: Gomukhasana (Cow Face Pose) is a beginner seated pose that opens hips and shoulders.  Stack shoulders, lengthen spine, and avoid forcing the knees.  Promotes flexibility and relaxation.

name: Easy Pose
description: Sukhasana (Easy Pose) is a beginner seated pose promoting relaxation and grounding.  Sit comfortably with a straight spine, engaging your core.  Benefits include improved posture and calmness.  Adjust your hips equally.

name: Fire Log Pose
description: Agnistambhasana (Fire Log Pose) is a beginner seated twist.  It improves digestion, spinal flexibility, and hip opening.  Keep your spine long, shoulders relaxed, and twist from the torso, not the neck.

name: Embryo in Womb Pose
description: Garbha Pindasana (Embryo Pose) is an advanced seated pose promoting deep relaxation and inner peace.  Fold forward, hugging knees to chest, resting forehead on the knees. Maintain a straight spine as much as possible for optimal benefit.

name: Foot Behind the Head I Pose
description: A challenging seated advanced pose (Eka Pada Shirshasana A).  Improves flexibility, balance, and hip opening.  Requires strong core engagement and careful spinal alignment to avoid neck strain.

name: Foot Behind the Head II Pose
description: A deep seated forward bend (Eka Pada Shirshasana B), requiring advanced flexibility.  Improves spinal mobility and hip flexibility.  Maintain a straight spine and engage core to avoid strain.

name: Seated Forward Bend I Pose
description: Seated Forward Bend I (Paschimottanasana A) stretches hamstrings, hips, and spine.  Sit tall, lengthen spine before bending forward, keeping a straight back.  Reach for feet, relax shoulders. Beginner-friendly.

name: Seated Forward Bend II Pose
description: A gentle seated forward bend (Paschimottanasana B), lengthening the spine and hamstrings.  Maintain a straight back initially, then lengthen from the hips.  Benefits include improved flexibility and stress reduction.

name: Seated Forward Bend III Pose
description: A deeper seated forward bend (Paschimottanasana C), lengthening the spine and hamstrings.  Maintain a straight back as you fold, focusing on lengthening the breath.  Benefits include improved flexibility and stress reduction.

name: Seated Forward Bend IV Pose
description: Seated Forward Bend IV (Paschimottanasana D) gently stretches the hamstrings, hips, and spine.  Sit tall, lengthen your spine before bending forward, keeping a straight back as much as possible.  Beginner-friendly for improved flexibility and relaxation.

name: Seated Half Bound Lotus Forward Bend Pose
description: Seated Half Bound Lotus Forward Bend (Ardha Baddha Padma Paschimottanasana) gently stretches the hips, groin, and hamstrings.  Keep your spine long, chest open, and breathe deeply into the stretch.  Beginner-friendly.

name: Seated Three Limbed Forward Bend Pose
description: A beginner-level seated forward bend, Tiryan Mukha Eka Pada Paschimottanasana stretches hamstrings, hips, and spine.  Keep your spine long, chest open, and lengthen through the sides of your body.

name: Garland Pose
description: Malasana (Garland Pose) is a beginner-seated pose.  Deeply stretch hips and ankles, opening the groin.  Keep knees wide, heels close to the ground, and torso upright for optimal benefit.

name: Seated Gate Pose
description: Seated Gate Pose (Parighasana) gently stretches the spine, shoulders, and hips.  Sit tall, lengthen your spine, and side bend, keeping hips grounded.  Breathe deeply to deepen the stretch. Beginner-friendly.

name: Head to Knee I Pose
description: Janu Shirshasana A (Head-to-Knee Pose I) is a beginner seated forward bend.  Lengthens hamstrings and hips, calms the mind.  Keep spine long,  chest lifted, and avoid forcing the stretch.

name: Head to Knee II Pose
description: A beginner-friendly seated forward bend (Janu Shirshasana B), stretching hamstrings and hips.  Keep your spine long, and avoid forcing the stretch; focus on lengthening your breath.  Benefits include improved flexibility and calm.

name: Head to Knee III Pose
description: Head-to-Knee Pose III (Janu Shirshasana C) is a beginner seated forward bend.  Lengthens hamstrings and hips, calms the mind.  Keep spine long, chest open, and avoid forcing the stretch.

name: Hero Pose
description: Virasana (Hero Pose): A beginner seated pose.  Kneel with feet together, sit back on heels (use blanket for support if needed).  Opens hips, stretches ankles, and promotes relaxation.  Keep spine straight, chest lifted.

name: Heron Pose
description: Heron Pose (Krounchasana) is a beginner seated twist improving hip flexibility and spine mobility.  Lengthen your spine, ground your sit bones, and twist gently from the torso, keeping your chest open.

name: Noose Pose
description: Pashasana (Noose Pose) is a beginner seated twist.  It gently massages abdominal organs, improves spinal flexibility, and relieves stress.  Keep your spine lengthened and twist from the torso, not the neck.

name: Half Pigeon Pose
description: Half Pigeon Pose (Ardha Kapotasana) opens hips and improves flexibility.  Beginners can modify by keeping the front knee over the ankle.  Focus on lengthening the spine and maintaining a neutral pelvis.

name: Lotus Pose
description: Padmasana (Lotus Pose):  A seated, intermediate pose promoting hip opening, spinal lengthening, and improved balance.  Ensure even hips and knees, avoiding forcing.  Maintain a straight spine and relaxed shoulders.

name: Sage Marichi's I Pose
description: Marichyasana A (Sage Marichyasana I): A beginner seated forward bend.  Lengthens the spine, improves hip flexibility, and calms the mind.  Maintain a straight spine, avoid rounding, and engage your core.

name: Sage Marichi's II Pose
description: Marichyasana II (Sage Marichi's II) is a beginner seated forward bend.  It gently stretches the spine and hips, improves digestion, and calms the nervous system.  Maintain a long spine and avoid rounding; lengthen through the crown of the head.

name: Sage Marichi's III Pose
description: Marichyasana C (Sage Marichi's III) is a beginner seated twist.  Lengthen your spine, gently twist, and keep your hips grounded.  Benefits include spinal mobility, digestion improvement, and stress relief.

name: Sage Marichi's IV Pose
description: A beginner-friendly seated twist (Marichyasana D), Marichi's IV Pose gently stretches the spine and hips.  Maintain a long spine and avoid collapsing; lengthen through the crown of your head.

name: Side Lunge Pose
description: Side Lunge (Skandasana): An intermediate seated balancing pose.  Stretches hips, groin, and inner thighs.  Keep front knee over ankle, lengthen spine, and engage core for stability.

name: Front Splits Pose
description: Hanumanasana (Front Splits) is an advanced seated pose stretching the hips, groin, and inner thighs.  Maintain a straight spine and engage core to prevent lower back strain.  Progress gradually to avoid injury.

name: Half Splits Pose
description: Ardha Hanumanasana (Half Splits) is an intermediate forward bend stretching the hamstrings and hip flexors.  Maintain a straight spine and engage your core to avoid strain.  Lengthen through the front leg, keeping hips square.

name: Wide Splits Pose
description: Samakonasana (Wide Splits) is an advanced seated pose requiring significant hip flexibility.  Benefits include improved hip mobility and flexibility.  Maintain a straight spine and engage core muscles to avoid strain.

name: Staff Pose
description: Dandasana (Staff Pose) is a foundational seated pose.  Improves posture and strengthens core and spine.  Sit tall with lengthened spine, engaged legs, and shoulders relaxed away from ears.

name: Thunderbolt Pose
description: Vajrasana (Thunderbolt Pose) is a beginner seated pose. Kneel with feet together, sit back on heels, and lengthen spine.  Benefits include improved digestion, relaxation, and hip opening.  Keep knees hip-width apart, and avoid this pose with knee injuries.

name: Toe Stand Pose
description: Padangushthasana (Toe Stand Pose) is an intermediate seated balancing pose.  Improve balance, focus, and ankle flexibility by grasping big toes and lifting hips. Maintain a straight spine and engaged core for stability.

name: Banana Pose
description: A beginner-friendly supine twist (Supta Nitambasana), Banana Pose gently opens hips and spine.  Keep shoulders flat on the floor and lengthen your spine for a deeper stretch.  Benefits include improved flexibility and stress relief.

name: Bridge Pose
description: Bridge Pose (Setu Bandha Sarvangasana) strengthens back, glutes, and hamstrings.  Press firmly through feet and shoulders, keeping thighs parallel.  Lengthen spine, avoiding neck strain.

name: Corpse Pose
description: Corpse Pose (Shavasana):  A beginner supine pose promoting deep relaxation.  Lie flat, arms relaxed beside your body, palms up.  Release tension, allowing for total physical and mental rest.  Benefits include stress reduction and improved sleep.

name: Fish Pose
description: Matsyasana (Fish Pose) is an intermediate backbend opening the chest and shoulders.  Lie on your back, lift your chest, and gently press your head into the floor, ensuring even weight distribution across your shoulders and back.  Benefits include improved posture and spinal flexibility.

name: Supine Foot to Head Pose
description: Supta Padāngusthāsana (Supine Foot-to-Head Pose) lengthens hamstrings and spine.  Lie on your back, extend one leg, and reach for your foot.  Maintain a straight spine and avoid forcing the stretch.

name: Extended Supine Hand to Big Toe Pose
description: Reclined Big Toe Pose (Supta Padangusthasana B) gently stretches hamstrings and hips.  Lie on your back, extend one leg, and use a strap or towel to reach your big toe, maintaining a straight spine.  Avoid pulling on your knee.

name: Supine Hand to Big Toe Pose
description: Lying on your back, gently reach for one big toe, lengthening the hamstring and groin.  Improves hip flexibility and relieves lower back tension. Maintain a flat back and avoid pulling on the leg; use a strap if needed.

name: Happy Baby Pose
description: Lie on your back and draw knees towards chest, grasping outer feet. Gently open knees wide, relaxing hips and lower back.  Releases tension, opens hips and groin.  Keep spine flat, avoid pulling on your neck.

name: Sleeping Yogi Pose
description: Sleeping Yogi (Yoga Nidrasana) is a supine, advanced relaxation pose promoting deep rest and stress reduction.  Maintain a neutral spine, relax your limbs completely, and focus on breath awareness.

name: Supine Spinal Twist Pose
description: A gentle supine twist (Supta Matsyendrasana), great for beginners.  Releases spinal tension, improves digestion, and calms the nervous system.  Keep shoulders flat on the floor and lengthen your spine.

name: Supine Straddle Pose
description: Lie on your back with legs wide, feet flexed.  Opens hips and inner thighs, relieves lower back tension.  Keep your spine flat, shoulders relaxed, and avoid straining. Intermediate level.

name: Waterfall Pose
description: Reclined Staff Pose (Supta Dandasana) is a beginner supine pose.  Lengthens the spine, opens the chest, and calms the nervous system. Keep legs straight, pressing through heels, and engage your core to protect your lower back.

name: Wind Removing Pose
description: Beginner-level supine pose (Pavanamuktasana) gently massages the abdomen, relieving gas and bloating.  Hug knees to chest, pressing spine to floor for optimal benefit.

name: Bow Pose
description: Bow Pose (Dhanurasana) is an intermediate prone backbend strengthening the back, shoulders, and chest.  Keep thighs and feet parallel, lengthen the spine, and gaze forward to avoid neck strain.

name: Half Bow Pose
description: Ardha Dhanurasana (Half Bow Pose) is an intermediate prone backbend.  Strengthens back muscles, opens chest and shoulders.  Keep hips grounded, lengthen spine, avoid hyperextension.

name: Child's Pose
description: Balasana (Child's Pose) is a beginner-level prone pose.  Resting the forehead on the mat, it gently stretches the hips, thighs, and ankles, relieving stress and promoting relaxation.  Keep hips towards heels and lengthen the spine.

name: Cobra Pose
description: Cobra Pose (Bhujangasana) is an intermediate backbend strengthening the spine and chest.  Lie prone, press into hands, gently lift chest, keeping shoulders relaxed and eyes softly forward.  Improves posture and flexibility.

name: Reverse Corpse Pose
description: Reverse Corpse Pose (Advasana) is a beginner prone pose.  Lie on your stomach, relaxing completely.  Benefits include spinal decompression and stress release.  Keep hips relaxed and chest open, avoiding strain.

name: Puppy Pose
description: Puppy Pose (Uttana Shishosana) gently stretches the shoulders, hips, and spine.  Keep hips lifted, chest and forehead towards the mat, and lengthen your spine to avoid collapsing.

name: Frog Pose
description: Frog Pose (Bhekasana) is an intermediate prone backbend opening hips and groin.  Keep knees wide, chest lifted, and engage inner thighs to protect lower back.  Builds hip flexibility and strength.

name: Locust I Pose
description: Locust I (Shalabhasana A) is an intermediate prone backbend strengthening the back, glutes, and shoulders.  Lift chest and legs simultaneously, engaging core and lengthening the spine. Keep hips grounded and gaze slightly forward.

name: Locust II Pose
description: Locust II (Shalabhasana B) strengthens back muscles and improves spinal flexibility.  Lie prone, lift chest, arms, and legs simultaneously, keeping core engaged and gaze forward.  Maintain a long spine and avoid hyperextension.

name: Locust III Pose
description: Locust III (Shalabhasana C) is an intermediate prone backbend strengthening the back, glutes, and shoulders.  Keep legs and arms extended, engaging core to lift, avoiding hyperextension.

name: Sage Gheranda's Pose
description: Gherandasana (Sage Gheranda's Pose) is an advanced prone backbend opening the chest and shoulders.  Maintain a straight spine, engage core, and avoid hyperextension. Improves spinal flexibility and strengthens back muscles.

name: Snake Pose
description: Snake Pose (Sarpasana) is a beginner prone backbend strengthening the spine and shoulders.  Lengthen your spine, engage your back muscles, and avoid hyperextending the neck.  Gently lift your chest and head.

name: Sphinx Pose
description: A gentle backbend, Sphinx Pose (Salamba Bhujangasana) strengthens the spine and opens the chest.  Keep hips grounded, lengthen the tailbone, and engage your core to avoid strain. Beginner-friendly.

name: Tortoise Pose
description: Kurmasana (Tortoise Pose) is an intermediate prone forward bend.  It stretches the hips, shoulders, and spine, improving flexibility and calming the mind.  Keep your knees wide, chest close to the floor, and maintain a neutral neck.

name: Table Pose
description: Table Pose (Bharmanasana) strengthens wrists, shoulders, and core.  Keep wrists under shoulders, hips over knees, and spine neutral, engaging your core for stability.  Beginner-friendly pose for building foundational strength.

name: Camel Pose
description: Camel Pose (Ushtrasana) is an intermediate backbend opening the chest and shoulders.  Maintain a neutral pelvis and lengthen your spine; avoid hyperextension.  Benefits include improved posture and flexibility.

name: Cat Pose
description: Cat Pose (Marjariasana) is a beginner-level backbend warming the spine.  Round your spine towards the ceiling, tucking your chin; then arch your back, lifting your head.  Improves posture, stretches the abdomen and back.

name: Cow Pose
description: Cow Pose (Bitilasana) is a gentle backbend, stretching the spine and chest.  Keep your shoulders relaxed, tailbone lifted, and gaze slightly upward.  Benefits include improved posture and stress relief.

name: Dolphin Pose
description: Dolphin Pose (Ardha Pincha Mayurasana) strengthens arms, shoulders, and wrists, stretching the spine and opening the chest.  Maintain a straight line from shoulders to hips, engaging core to prevent sagging.

name: Downward-Facing Dog Pose
description: Downward-Facing Dog (Adho Mukha Shvanasana) strengthens arms, legs, and shoulders, lengthening the spine.  Keep hands shoulder-width apart, hips high, and heels reaching towards the floor; lengthen the tailbone.

name: Eight Point Pose
description: Ashtangasana (Eight-Point Pose) is an intermediate arm and leg balancing pose.  Benefits include increased strength and focus.  Maintain straight arms and legs, engaging core and glutes for stability.

name: Humble Flamingo Pose
description: Humble Flamingo (Vineeta Rajahamsasana) is an advanced balancing pose requiring arm and leg strength.  Benefits include improved balance, core strength, and flexibility.  Maintain a straight spine and engage your core for stability.

name: Gate Pose
description: Parighasana (Gate Pose) is a beginner lateral bend stretching the spine and hips.  Keep hips squared, lengthen the spine, and avoid collapsing into the pose.  Benefits include improved flexibility and balance.

name: Horse Pose
description: Horse Pose (Vatayanasana) is an intermediate balancing pose strengthening legs and core.  Maintain a straight spine, grounded hips, and engage inner thighs.  Develops balance and stability.

name: Lizard Pose
description: Lizard Pose (Uttana Pristhasana) opens hips and groin.  Maintain a straight front leg, lengthen your spine, and keep your chest lifted.  Intermediate level; strengthens legs and improves flexibility.

name: Lunge Pose
description: Lunge Pose (Utthita Ashwa Sanchalanasana) strengthens legs and opens hips.  Keep front knee behind ankle, torso upright, and hips square.  Beginner-friendly, great for flexibility and balance.

name: Crooked Monkey Pose
description: Vakra Hanumanasana (Crooked Monkey Pose) is an intermediate twist strengthening hips, groin, and spine.  Maintain a straight spine, lengthen through the torso, and avoid collapsing into the twist.

name: Pigeon Pose
description: Pigeon Pose (Kapotasana) deeply stretches hips and thighs.  Advanced pose requiring strong core and hip flexibility.  Maintain a neutral spine, avoid forcing the twist, and listen to your body's limitations.

name: One Legged King Pigeon Pose
description: Eka Pada Raja Kapotasana (One-Legged King Pigeon Pose) is an advanced seated backbend.  It opens hips and chest, improving flexibility and spinal mobility.  Maintain a long spine, engage core, and avoid forcing the backbend.

name: Plank Pose
description: Plank (Phalakasana) strengthens core, arms, and shoulders.  Maintain a straight line from head to heels, engaging glutes and core to prevent sagging hips.  Beginner-friendly, but focus on proper form.

name: Upward Plank Pose
description: Upward Plank (Purvottanasana) strengthens shoulders, wrists, and spine.  Beginner-friendly backbend.  Keep shoulders down, chest lifted, and gaze slightly upward, engaging core for stability.

name: Four Limbed Staff Pose
description: Chaturanga Dandasana (Four-Limbed Staff Pose) strengthens arms, shoulders, and core.  Maintain a straight line from head to heels, elbows close to body, and avoid sagging hips.  Beginner-friendly, but build strength gradually.

name: Flying Warrior Pose
description: A challenging balancing pose (Vishvamitrasana),  strengthening core, legs, and arms.  Extend your side body, maintaining a straight spine and engaged core for stability.  Advanced practitioners only.

name: Side Plank Pose
description: Side Plank (Vasishthasana) strengthens core, wrists, and legs.  Maintain a straight line from head to heels, engaging your obliques and lengthening your spine.  Avoid collapsing the hips.

name: Extended Side Plank Pose
description: Utthita Vasishthasana (Extended Side Plank) strengthens core, arms, and legs.  Maintain a straight line from head to heels, engaging your obliques and lengthening your spine.  Advanced pose requiring good shoulder and wrist stability.

name: Inverted Staff Pose
description: Inverted Staff Pose (Dvi Pada Viparita Dandasana) strengthens arms, shoulders, and back.  Maintain a straight line from head to heels, engaging core to protect lower back.  Improves balance and opens chest.

name: Little Thunderbolt Pose
description: Laghu Vajrasana (Little Thunderbolt Pose) is an intermediate backbend strengthening the back and shoulders.  Keep thighs grounded, chest lifted, and gaze forward to avoid neck strain.  Improves spinal flexibility and balance.

name: Tiger Pose
description: Tiger Pose (Vyaghrasana) is a beginner backbend strengthening the back and shoulders.  Extend one leg back, arm opposite, chest lifted.  Maintain a flat back and engage core for spinal support.

name: Upward-Facing Dog Pose
description: Upward-Facing Dog (Urdhva Mukha Shvanasana) strengthens arms, shoulders, and spine.  Press into hands and feet, lengthening the spine, keeping shoulders away from ears.  Beginner-friendly backbend.

name: Wheel Pose
description: Wheel Pose (Urdhva Dhanurasana) is an intermediate backbend strengthening the back, shoulders, and chest.  Arch deeply, pressing through hands and feet, keeping shoulders away from ears and legs engaged for spinal support.

name: Wild Thing Pose
description: Wild Thing (Chamatkarasana) is a playful backbend strengthening shoulders, chest, and spine.  Keep hips square, lengthen the front body, and gaze upward, avoiding neck strain.  Beginner-friendly, but build gradually.

name: Both Feet Behind the Head II Pose
description: A challenging arm balance (Dvi Pada Shirshasana B), requiring significant shoulder and core strength.  Improves balance, strengthens arms and shoulders.  Maintain straight arms, engage core, and keep hips lifted.

name: Chin Stand Pose
description: Ganda Bherundasana (Chin Stand) is an advanced arm balance and inversion requiring strong shoulders and core.  Benefits include improved balance, strength, and spinal flexibility.  Ensure straight arms, engaged core, and a balanced weight distribution on the head and hands.

name: Crane Pose
description: Bakasana (Crane Pose) is an intermediate arm balance strengthening wrists, shoulders, and core.  Engage core, lengthen spine, and distribute weight evenly between hands and forearms for stability.

name: Crow Pose
description: Crow Pose (Kakasana) is an intermediate arm balance strengthening wrists, shoulders, and core.  Engage core, keep shoulders over wrists, and gaze forward to maintain balance.  Requires strength and practice.

name: Deaf Man's Pose
description: Karnapidasana (Deaf Man's Pose): An intermediate inversion & forward bend.  Press ears to shoulders, lengthening the spine.  Benefits include calming the nervous system and relieving stress.  Maintain a straight back to avoid neck strain.

name: Eight Angle Pose
description: Ashtavakrasana (Eight Angle Pose) is a challenging arm balance.  Builds strength and flexibility in shoulders, wrists, and core.  Maintain a straight line from head to heels, engage core, and distribute weight evenly across forearms.

name: Elbow Balance Pose
description: A challenging arm balance (Shayanasana), requiring core strength and shoulder stability.  Builds upper body strength, improves balance, and stimulates the nervous system.  Maintain straight arms and a strong core, engaging your legs.

name: Elephant Trunk Pose
description: Elephant Trunk Pose (Eka Hasta Bhujasana) is an intermediate arm balance.  Strengthen wrists, shoulders, and core while improving balance and focus.  Maintain a straight arm and engaged core; gaze forward.

name: Firefly Pose
description: Firefly Pose (Tittibhasana) is a challenging arm balance strengthening wrists, shoulders, and core.  Maintain straight arms, engage inner thighs, and lengthen your spine.  Requires advanced strength and balance.

name: Floating Stick Pose
description: Brahmacharyasana (Floating Stick Pose) is an intermediate arm balance strengthening wrists, shoulders, and core.  Maintain straight arms and legs, engaging your core to lift hips high, gaze forward.

name: Flying Man Pose
description: Eka Pada Koundinyasana (Flying Man Pose) is an intermediate arm balance.  Strengthens arms, shoulders, and core.  Maintain straight arms, lengthen spine, and engage core for stability.  Gaze forward.

name: Revolved Flying Man Pose
description: A challenging arm balance and twist (Parivritta Eka Pada Koundinyasana), Revolved Flying Man builds strength, improves balance, and deepens spinal rotation.  Maintain a straight arm and engaged core; lengthen through the spine to avoid collapsing.

name: Two Legged Sage Koundinya's Pose
description: Dvi Pada Koundinyasana (Two-Legged Sage Koundinya's Pose) is an advanced arm balance.  Builds arm strength, core stability, and balance.  Requires strong wrists and shoulders; maintain straight arms and engaged core.

name: Side Crow Pose
description: A challenging arm balance (Parsva Bakasana), Side Crow builds strength and stability.  Engage core, straighten arms, and shift weight evenly onto forearms, twisting torso towards the floor for balance.

name: Forearm Balance Pose
description: A challenging arm balance (Pincha Mayurasana), requiring core strength and shoulder stability.  Builds upper body strength, improves balance, and stimulates the nervous system.  Engage core, lengthen spine, and distribute weight evenly between forearms.

name: Dragonfly  Pose
description: Dragonfly Pose (Maksikanagasana) is an advanced arm balance requiring strong shoulders and core.  Benefits include improved balance, arm strength, and hip flexibility.  Maintain straight arms, engage core, and lengthen the spine for proper alignment.

name: Handstand Pose
description: Adho Mukha Vrikshasana (Handstand) is an advanced arm balance inversion.  Strengthens wrists, shoulders, core, and improves balance.  Align wrists under shoulders, gaze forward, and engage core for stability.

name: Supported Headstand Pose
description: Supported Headstand (Salamba Shirshasana A) builds strength and balance.  Forearms shoulder-width apart, elbows firmly pressed into the mat, crown of head on the floor,  maintain a straight line from shoulders to hips for optimal spinal alignment.

name: Tripod Headstand Pose
description: Tripod Headstand (Salamba Shirshasana B) is an intermediate arm balance inversion.  Benefits include strength building and improved balance.  Ensure forearms are parallel, elbows shoulder-width apart, and weight distributed evenly.

name: Flying Lizard Pose
description: A challenging arm balance (Uddayana Uttana Pristhasana), Flying Lizard Pose strengthens arms, shoulders, and core.  Maintain a straight front leg and lengthen your spine, engaging your core to prevent collapsing.

name: Peacock Pose
description: Mayurasana (Peacock Pose) is a challenging arm balance strengthening wrists, core, and shoulders.  Maintain straight arms, engage core, and lengthen spine to avoid strain.  Advanced practitioners only.

name: Pendant Pose
description: Lolasana (Pendant Pose) is an intermediate arm balance strengthening wrists, shoulders, and core.  Maintain straight arms, engage core, and lengthen spine, avoiding collapsing at the waist.

name: Flying Pigeon Pose
description: A challenging arm balance and twist (Eka Pada Galavasana), Flying Pigeon Pose strengthens core and arms, improves balance, and opens hips.  Maintain a straight arm and engaged core; avoid collapsing into the shoulder.

name: Plow Pose
description: In Plow Pose (Halasana), lie on your back and extend your legs over your head, resting your toes on the floor.  This beginner inversion calms the mind, stretches the spine and shoulders, and improves digestion.  Keep your neck long and supported.

name: Rooster Pose
description: Kukkutasana (Rooster Pose) is an advanced arm balance strengthening wrists, shoulders, and core.  Maintain straight arms, engage core, and press actively through palms for stability.  Requires significant upper body strength and balance.

name: Scorpion Pose
description: A challenging advanced backbend inversion (Vrschikasana A).  Builds strength & flexibility in the spine and shoulders. Requires strong core engagement and careful spinal alignment to avoid injury.

name: Shoulder Pressing Pose
description: Bhujapidasana (Shoulder Pressing Pose) is an advanced arm balance strengthening shoulders, wrists, and core.  Maintain straight arms, engage core, and press firmly through shoulders and palms for stability.

name: Shoulder Stand with Lotus Legs Pose
description: Urdhva Padmasana (Shoulder Stand with Lotus Legs): An advanced inversion requiring strong shoulders and hips.  Benefits include calming the nervous system and stimulating thyroid.  Maintain a straight spine and engage core to protect neck.

name: Supported Shoulder Stand Pose
description: Supported Shoulder Stand (Salamba Sarvangasana) is an intermediate inversion that calms the mind, improves circulation, and gently stretches the neck and shoulders.  Maintain a straight line from shoulders to hips, supporting your back with hands or blocks.

name: Bound Revolved Chair Pose
description: Bound Revolved Chair Pose (Parivritta Utkatasana) strengthens legs and core while deepening a spinal twist.  Maintain a tall spine, engage core, and bind arms for a deeper twist.  Intermediate level.
